Text: Zeta!!!

You're barely recognizable from the last time we
fought. Your movements are sluggish, and you
lack any sense of leadership.
Urk!

(That was quite clever of Gamma to predict this
turn of events and to ensure I alone dealt with
the Templars' main army.)
(That's right, this girl...Victoria can't kill me.)

(In other words, having me handle the Templars on my
own significantly weakens this unit led by Victoria.
Their response is a far cry from when Lady Alpha
was with me.)
...Is the Shadow Garden curing the possessed?

That's right. The possessed we rescue today will
also be cured by us, the Shadow Garden.

The Shadow Garden is an organization that lurks in
the darkness and hunts down shadows to destroy the
Cult of Diablos.

But we also protect and cure the possessed, giving
them a new way of life.

Most stay on and become soldiers for the Garden,
but we have other paths for those who don't
desire to fight.

In any case, I have no way to prove this, nor do I
intend to prove anything to your kind.

It's not like you can report what I just told you to
the high-ups of the Church, can you?
But!
(...Hmm. I see.)

(This prophetess doesn't wish to kill the possessed
if they can be saved.)

(Well then, crude as it may be, I'll take advantage
of that along with her strange fondness for me.)

Off with you. I've lost my appetite for taking your
life.
Zeta...

It seems you personally have no interest in senseless
killings.

In a sense, so long as you don't try to kill the
possessed, you're not really an enemy of the
Garden.

(If she fails to complete her mission at the cost of
her subordinates' lives and returns unscathed, the
Church's higher-ups will look upon her suspiciously.)

(They'll question if she is conspiring with the
enemy... Accumulating distrust will no doubt
weaken the Templars' organization from within.)

There's the signal to withdraw. Looks like Lady Alpha
and the others pulled it off.
Oh!
...W-We did it! We successfully cured her!
Good job, Epsilon. Well done.

H-Hardly, Lady Alpha! I doubt it would've
succeeded if it weren't for the many hours
you spent massaging her!

...It took over 4 hours! Usually, it wouldn't take
more than 5 minutes to cure.

I'm sure Shadow would've done a better job of it.
Anyway, go and summon everyone, Epsilon.
Understood!

...Her condition...is stable. She's sleeping...
like a baby...

She may have been a possessed human, but she looks
like a regular human.

That's right. She's a regular human. Just like we're
regular elves and therianthropes.

A tiny bit of the blood of heroes runs in our
veins... That's the only real difference.

...But, as a possessed human, I was thinking this
Nicoletta Marquez should have a symbolic role
in the Garden beyond that of a trainee.

Yes, I agree... It holds significant meaning to the
Shadow Garden that she is a human.

In other words...if this former daughter of a
marquis chooses to fight the Cult...

You're suggesting she would become some sort of
symbolic presence who embodies the fact that she's
a human in the Shadow Garden.

That's right. Whether she desires it or not, we, the
Shadow Garden, will task her...No. 93, with this
position and responsibility in the future.

In that case, we'll need to leave her Numbers' title
unassigned for a while.

This will be my first attempt at training a human as
a warrior for the Garden.

As she differs from elves and therianthropes, I would
like to take my time to ensure she is properly trained.

Understood, Lambda. It won't be an easy feat,
but we'll be relying on you.
Sir! Yes sir!

(Will you ultimately choose to call yourself "Nu"?
Or something else altogether?)

(...Until you decide of your own volition the path
you will walk, we, the Shadow Garden, will continue
to protect you.)
...And so that's what happened.
Hmm. I see. Interesting...

(A 4-hour massage to cure the possessed? Both parties
must've been exhausted!)

(Anyway, I guess they've grasped that they need to
get the magic flowing, so there shouldn't be any
issues moving forward.)

I want to run lots of experiments...on the possessed
human.
Ah, I knew you were going to say that.
...Can I?
Of course not, Eta. We still only have one of them!
Then how about when we get ten of them?

It's not a matter of how many... Look, you'll need to
at least get their consent, okay?
Jeez... What a hassle...

(Eta's a tough oneunhinged and unwavering.
The fact she doesn't question her own radical
thinking is frightening.)
(...But, in a way, I admire her attitude.)

(She's willing to sacrifice anything for the sake of
her goals. It's people with attitudes like that who
can achieve great feats.)

In that case...I'll just need to start experimenting
with ways to get their approval!

Uh, well, sure, but try moderating it to a level that
doesn't get Alpha riled up, okay?

Whew, it's getting chilly... This room can get pretty
cold during this time of year...

...Do you want an artifact that makes this room nice
and warm?
Honestly? I would love that.

But if we installed one of those heating artifacts
used in the royal family's castle into the house of a
poor aristocratic family like mine, it would stand
out like a sore thumb.

I didn't know you hated the cold so much, Master.
Heheh...

I wish this room at least had a fireplace! Or maybe
an oil stove
Oil?
Is that more Shadow Wisdom?

(Hold on... I'm not sure if it's safe to blatantly talk
about this, since the laws of nature in this world are
sometimes fundamentally different from what I know.)

(For example, you can catch tuna on the beach instead
of going all the way out to sea. I'm not even sure if oil
exists in this world...)
(But I'll take my chances!)

Oil... It's a shimmering pitch-black substance,
a forgotten relic of an ancient way of life.

Not only is it Shadow Wisdom, but it's also a
Shadow Resource that will flip the state of
energy in this world on its head!
Oooh! Tell me more, Master!
